item.title: Pack Coolant (Inlet/Exit Doors) Systems – Inlet Doors

remarks.para: One inlet door may be inoperative secured 60% open to full open provided:

numlitem.para: Remaining two packs are operative,
Associated turbine bypass valve is operative, and
Associated exit door is secured at least 50% open.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: If inlet door is inoperative open, monitor pack output temperature due to high temperature at low altitudes.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated PACK selector "INLET COOLING DR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: Refer to CDL Item 21-62-1 for missing inlet door:

numlitem.para: Secure inlet and exit door(s) as required to meet position requirements:

note.para: IF THE FOLLOWING PROCEDURES CANNOT BE MET, SEE MEL 21-62-2-0-1

numlitem.para: Open the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.
Disconnect the electrical connector from door actuator.
Install Allen wrench into adapter on end of gearbox opposite linear screw.

caution.para: TURN WRENCH BY HAND ONLY. A TORQUE GREATER THAN 15 INCH POUNDS MAY DAMAGE ACTUATOR GEARS.

numlitem.para: Move door to desired position:

If pack to be used with an inoperative inlet door, position inlet door at least 60% open. This corresponds to 9.45 inches between centerline of actuator support bolt and centerline of ram bolt (see illustration).

Position exit door at least 50% open. If pack is to be used with an inoperative exit door, position it full open if possible (louver doors are approximately vertical); otherwise pack may trip off when operated in warm ambient conditions.
Loosen strain relief clamp supporting the removed electrical connector’s wiring bundle.
Disconnect the wire from pin 6, pin 7, and pin 8. Individually, sleeve the disconnected wires per Boeing Standard Wiring Practices Manual section 20-10-15 using sleeve material RT-876.

note.para: The shorting wire in the following step is UPS P/N 747-21-004-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 4 inch shorting wire from type UA (BMS 13-48 TY VIII CL 1) 20-gauge wire and two 20-gauge sockets P/N BACC47CP1A.
Insert fabricated shorting wire to connector pins 6 and 8. Note that pin 7, on the connector’s back side, will remain unconnected.
Stow the following wires to the connector’s wiring bundle per Boeing Standard Wiring Practice Manual section 20-10-11:
Wire disconnected and sleeved per step F above.
Excess wire from shorting wire connected per step H above.
Tighten the strain relief clamp supporting the wiring bundle.
Reconnect the electrical connector, with shorting wire installed, to the inlet/exit door actuator(s).
Close the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.
